intro: Poterium lasiocarpum, commonly known as the woolly fruit-bearing plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, woolly appearance, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds covered in a fine, silky hair. It is native to regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. Poterium lasiocarpum thrives in dry, arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
